title: William Guthrie
text:
William Douglas Guthrie (born January 17, 1967 in <a href="St.%20Louis">St. Louis</a>, <a href="Missouri">MO</a>) is a professional <a href="boxing">boxer</a> (185 cm height) in the <a href="Cruiserweight%20%28boxing%29">cruiserweight</a> (180<a href="pound%20%28mass%29">lb</a>) division.
Early life.
Prior to fighting, Guthrie was an admitted former player in the St Louis drugs scene, and he had been kicked off the 1988 US Olympic team after failing a drug test. He also later spent time in prison for drug possession <a href="http%3A//uk.sports.yahoo.com/02082006/4/guthrie-s-road-redemption.html"></a>.
Amateur career.
Guthrie was the 1985 <a href="National%20Golden%20Gloves">National Golden Gloves</a> middleweight champion
Pro career.
Guthrie turned pro in 1989 and captured the Vacant IBF Light Heavyweight Title in 1997 with a win over <a href="Darrin%20Allen">Darrin Allen</a>. He was seen as a looming threat to <a href="Roy%20Jones%20Jr">Roy Jones Jr</a> at light heavyweight due to his punching power, but instead of a unification bout, he lost the title in his next fight to <a href="Reggie%20Johnson%20%28boxer%29">Reggie Johnson</a> by a knockout in the 5th. The knockout was a brutal one, and Guthrie left the ring on a stretcher <a href="http%3A//www.boxingtimes.com/analyses/1998/980206johnson_guthrie.html"></a>. Instead of retiring, he instead moved up to cruiserweight and continued to fight, but has not fought for a belt since.
